aboutMe.title: About Me
aboutMe.presentation: My name is Thomas Koenig, and I’m a second-year Computer Science student at IUT Lyon 1. Passionate about web and software development, I also compete in virtual reality (VR) at a high level, which has taught me teamwork and the drive to excel. Curious and self-reliant, I’m always looking to grow by taking on new technical challenges. I’m ready to contribute to concrete and innovative projects.

projects.title: Studea - Apprenticeship Management Application
projects.description:
Studea is a web application for managing apprentices developed with Symfony and Vue.js.
It allows administrators to manage apprentice information through a dynamic interface with CSV/XML file reading, AJAX routes, error handling, and modular table displays. The entire project was developed in an agile environment using Git for version control.
projects.details:
Studea is a web application developed with Symfony (API) and Vue.js (frontend) to facilitate apprentice management within a company.
It centralizes apprentice data and enables dynamic data manipulation through modern, interactive interfaces.

During my internship, I contributed to the addition and improvement of many features, including the implementation of dynamic tables connected to the Symfony API,
the use of AJAX routes to optimize interface responsiveness, and the automated processing of CSV and XML files.
I also worked on frontend and backend error handling to improve application reliability.

I helped make the application more ergonomic by adapting the user interface and integrating tests to validate new features.
The entire project followed an agile methodology with strict Git-based version tracking.
This experience strengthened my fullstack skills and gave me insight into the challenges of business applications in a professional context.

projects.title: Personal Portfolio – Web Developer Showcase
projects.description:
This portfolio is a single-page web application developed with SvelteKit to showcase my skills, projects, and experience.
It includes smooth animations, a responsive design, and a dynamic layout to highlight my work and technical profile.
projects.details:
My personal portfolio is built using SvelteKit, a modern web framework designed for speed and simplicity.
It presents my background, featured projects, and skills through a clean, interactive interface.

The portfolio is structured as a single-page application (SPA), with smooth scrolling and transition animations for an optimal user experience.
Skills are showcased in horizontally scrollable sections, and each project has its own dedicated modal with detailed information.

I designed the interface to be both aesthetic and functional, with Tailwind CSS and accessibility in mind.
The site is fully responsive and optimized for performance, using lazy loading and minimal external dependencies.
This project allowed me to deepen my front-end skills, particularly in Svelte, animations, component reusability, and responsive design.

projects.title: PanierVIP – Shopping List Management Site
projects.description: PHP/Symfony website allowing creation, management, and editing of shared shopping lists, with authentication, dynamic forms, and MySQL database.
projects.details:
PanierVIP is a website developed with PHP and Symfony that lets users create, manage, and share shopping lists online.
The app features a secure interface with authentication, dynamic forms to add/edit list items, and a MySQL database for data persistence.
It also includes permission management so multiple users can collaborate on the same list.
This project helped me get familiar with Symfony, form management, and relational databases in a web context.

projects.title: SmartDesk – Agenda Management Application
projects.description:
SmartDesk is a web application for agenda and productivity management developed with Svelte and Node.js.
It features an interactive calendar, task manager, customizable widgets (notes, music, etc.), and a responsive interface. This project, developed in a team using agile methods, allowed me to work on the overall design and widget management.
projects.details:
SmartDesk is a collaborative agenda and productivity management application built with Svelte (frontend) and Node.js (backend).
Developed by a team of four students in an agile context, the app allows users to organize tasks, manage a calendar, take notes, and use interactive widgets like a music player.
I mainly contributed to the design of the account and login pages, ensuring their interactivity and responsiveness across devices.
This project helped me strengthen my fullstack web development, UI/UX, and project management skills.

projects.title: JAVA SAE – Graph Visualization and Aircraft Collision Avoidance
projects.description: Java Swing application for creating, coloring, and visualizing graphs representing French airspace, with the goal of modeling aircraft collision avoidance.
projects.details:
This university project, completed as part of a SAE, aimed to develop a Java Swing application to model airspace and simulate aircraft collision avoidance using colored graphs and dedicated algorithms.

The application allows users to load flight and airport data, generate trajectory graphs, and apply coloring algorithms to reduce conflicts. The Swing-based GUI lets users visualize and manipulate the graph, import/export data, and get collision risk statistics.

I mainly developed the logic for CSV import and collision risk calculation.

This project improved my Java skills, GUI design, algorithmic thinking, and teamwork.
